recipe.notes: **UNTRIED** I never had a chance to get into this, preferring mulled wine or spiced (and spiked) cider for my yuletide inebriation needs. Still -- Dickens, Wassail, how can you go wrong?
recipe.name: Dicken's Wassail
recipe.preparation:
Put apples into a deep casserole. Combine 1/4 cup sugar and the water in a saucepan; bring to boil.
Pour syrup over apples. Cover casserole.
Bake at 350F 30 to 40 minutes or until apples are tender, basting occasionally.
Pour ale into a saucepan and heat on low heat until it foams.
Add spices, sherry and 1/12 cups sugar, lemon peel and lemon juice. Heat, stirring until sugar is dissolved.
Set aside 20 minutes.
Reheat mixture and pour through a double thickness of cheesecloth into a heatproof punch bowl.
Add apples.
Ladle wassail into cups, garnish with lemon peel.
